title: Retail Expansion Senior Project Manager - Italy
content:
Established in 1981 with a single store in the Northwest of England, the JD Group is a leading omni-channel retailer of Sports Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues and over 3,400 stores across several retail fascias in over 30 markets around the world.
JD Italy counts around 50 stores with over 1,700 employees.

Role Overview
Takes overall responsibility for the Management of the Italy Projects Team. Overseeing the day-to-day management of New Stores, Refurbishment and Acquisition Projects working to strict deadlines to support the European Expansion Programme.
This is a field based position.
The role focuses driving the project delivery of circa 50+ European Projects per year including cost & budget management via a team of in-house PM’s that will work across Southern Europe primarily in Italy, but with the possibility expanding into other European Countries as required. This role supports and promotes our existing European remit to act as a centre of excellence to drive store standards to a market leading level.
 
Key Duties/Responsibilities:
Reporting to the Group European Projects Manager you will oversee the Management of Retail Expansion Projects in Italy.

Managing a Team of in-house Project Managers, you will manage and oversee the day-to-day programme and project management across several Countries ensuring that all responsible areas are managed to a satisfactory and consistent fashion throughout the overall project cycle of new stores, re-fits, and extensions.
Work to the highest standards whilst adopting smart programming methods and supporting the team and their projects whilst always promoting a strong cost focus. This includes managing and coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultants to deliver projects to plan. On time and on budget.
Lead and support the Regional Project Team delivering progress reports, proposals, documentation, and presentations where appropriate.
Strive for excellence in all JD processes within the Projects team, continually reviewing and developing improvements.
An ability to Train, educate, develop & monitor individual & team performance recognising development opportunities.
Working closely with the Team of Quantity Surveyors. You and your Team will be required to promote, monitor, and help oversee the budget for each project allowing the QS to regularly update on the project status.
Ensure best practice and minimum standards are adopted with health and safety is always adhered to.
Strive for excellence in all JD processes within the project & design team, continually reviewing and developing process whilst implementing improvements.
Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential risks and devise contingency plans as required.
Coach, mentor, motivate and supervise project team members and contractors encouraging them to take positive action and assume accountability for their assigned work.
The role demands the direct Management of some store projects during peak expansion periods from €350k to €5m based on the demands and volumes that the business presents.

Skills/Experience/Knowledge needed:

Construction/Retail Fit Out experience: You will have a sound knowledge and experience of the European construction and shop fit industry including the various legislation processes across Europe ensuring that the Project Managers deliver to the highest standards.
Project Management experience: You will have a proven track record of delivering Retail High St, Shopping Centre & Flagship locations in Europe whilst being able to manage multiple, simultaneous projects across several group fascia’s keeping them on budget and delivering them on time & to a high standard.
You will have ideally managed a similar European Team and can demonstrate skills to how you maximise on productivity and lead a cost-effective team.
Excellent communication & influencing skills: You will have the ability to communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders and across departments.
Numerate and strong attention to detail.
Qualifications: You will be educated to university degree level or possess a college diploma in Project Management or equivalent experience.
This role is field based, and you will need to be geographically mobile ideally residing in Italy to support the management of the expanding store portfolio with visits to UK Head Office required.
Self-motivated, but Team Leader.
Technically competent with various software programmes.
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
React to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently.
Flexible during times of change.
Overtime may be required to meet project deadlines and supporting the Project management Team.
Extensive travel and periods of time away from home as required.
Bilingual with languages. English & Italian being the most distinct advantage.
Full European Driving Licence essential.
